p.k: The "charro", term that comes from military charreteras (Epaulettes) that horse riders use, is one of Mexico's national symbols. Their figure appeared towars XVII century under the influence of Andalusian immigration, central for movies, paintings and charreria Mexico's national sport. Charreria takes this legendary figure, it's origins, history and presets of charros, living on a country under constant Modernization.
